CancerTypes.CESC: Cervical squamous cell carcinoma and endocervical adenocarcinoma
CancerTypes.HNSC: Head and Neck squamous cell carcinoma

Algorithms.pca: Principal Component Analysis. Add further description here.
Algorithms.tree: Decision Tree. Add further description here.
Algorithms.norm: Normalized Feature Selection. Add further description here.
Algorithms.basic: Feature Selection. Add further description here.
Algorithms.sfs: Sequential Forward Selection. Add further description here.
Algorithms.ea: Evolutionary Algorithm. Add further description here.

Parameters.k: The number of features (genes) that are returned.
Parameters.n: The number of features (genes) that is excluded from the calculation to increase performance.
Parameters.m: The number of preselected features (genes) that are used for the calculation to increase performance.
Parameters.norm: The normalization method used to reduce the impact of underlying differences in healthy tissue.
Parameters.fitness: The fitness function used to evaluate the intermediate results.
Parameters.n_components: The number of principal components gathered by the PCA.
Parameters.n_features_per_component: The number of features that should be returned per prinicpal component.

Evaluation.F1Sick: F1 score for reeeeally sick stuff. Edit description please.
Evaluation.F1Healthy: F1 score for the healthy shizzle. Edit description please.
Evaluation.CombinedFitness: CombinedFitness score of our evluation. Edit description to be helpful, please.

GeneExpression.General: Genes are differently expressed. Edit me.
GeneExpression.TotalScores: The calculated total scores that reflect how much a gene is already connected with cancer.
GeneExpression.GeneScoreExplanation: If a gene is not found in one of the databases, we also check for coexpressed genes. This can result in two results being displayed in one cell (in case the coexpressed gene returned a positive result).

General.Run: Some combinations not allowed, yo! Edit me.
